vote.title: To amend the 2024 Capital Improvement Budget; to authorize the City Attorney's Office to contract for professional services relative to the acquisition of fee simple title and lesser interests in and to property needed for Urban Infrastructure Recovery Fund projects; to authorize the City Attorney's Office to negotiate with property owners to acquire the additional rights-of-way necessary to complete Urban Infrastructure Recovery Fund projects; to authorize the expenditure of $225,000.00 from the Streets and Highways Bond Fund to acquire the needed rights-of-way. ($225,000.00)
vote.description:
Explanation 
1.  BACKGROUND
This ordinance authorizes the Director of the Department of Public Service to establish a contingency fund to be used by the City Attorney's Office to acquire miscellaneous small parcels of right-of-way needed for the successful completion of Urban Infrastructure Recovery Fund (UIRF) projects throughout the City, and also authorizes the City Attorney's Office to hire professional services (e.g. surveys, title work, appraisals, etc.) and to negotiate with property owners to acquire the property rights necessary to complete the various UIRF projects as needed.  The professional service providers and property owners will be identified as plans are developed for the various UIRF projects.
 
UIRF projects are developed as the result of a partnership between City staff in multiple departments and community stakeholders in central city urban areas.  The Department of Public Service is engaged in the design and construction of various UIRF projects throughout the City.  These projects do not typically require the establishment of a project specific right-of-way acquisition fund.  Due to unforeseen circumstances, it sometimes becomes necessary to acquire small parcels of right-of-way to complete a project.  This contingency fund will allow these parcels to be acquired without delaying the project while awaiting the passage of an ordinance authorizing a project specific purchase.     
 
2.  FISCAL IMPACT
Funds in the amount of $225,000.00 are budgeted, appropriated and available for this project in Fund 7704, the Street & Highways Bond Fund.  An amendment to the 2024 Capital Improvements Budget is necessary for the purpose of providing sufficient spending authority for the aforementioned project expenditure.
 
Title
To amend the 2024 Capital Improvement Budget; to authorize the City Attorney's Office to contract for professional services relative to the acquisition of fee simple title and lesser interests in and to property needed for Urban Infrastructure Recovery Fund projects; to authorize the City Attorney's Office to negotiate with property owners to acquire the additional rights-of-way necessary to complete Urban Infrastructure Recovery Fund projects; to authorize the expenditure of $225,000.00 from the Streets and Highways Bond Fund to acquire the needed rights-of-way. ($225,000.00)
 
Body
WHEREAS, the Department of Public Service is engaged in the design and construction of various UIRF projects throughout the City; and
 
WHEREAS, successful completion of UIRF projects sometimes necessitates the City acquire fee simple title and lesser interests in and to various properties located along the project corridor as additional rights-of-way; and
 
WHEREAS, the professional service providers and property owners will be identified as plans are developed for the various UIRF projects; and 
 
WHEREAS, the establishment of a contingency fund will allow these small acquisitions to be made without delaying the completion of a project; and
 
WHEREAS, this ordinance authorizes funding in the amount of $225,000.00 for that purpose; and
 
WHEREAS, it is necessary to authorize an amendment to the 2024 Capital Improvements Budget for the purpose of providing sufficient spending authority for the aforementioned project expenditure; and
 
WHEREAS, the City Attorney's Office must be authorized to expend $225,000.00, or so much thereof as may be necessary, to hire professional services (e.g. surveys, title work, appraisals, etc.) and to negotiate with property owners to acquire the various property rights necessary to complete UIRF projects; now, therefore
 
BE IT ORDAINED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
SECTION 1.  That the 2024 Capital Improvements Budget authorized by ordinance 1907-2024 be amended as follows to establish  sufficient authority for this project:
 
Fund / Project  / Project Name / Current  / Change /C.I.B. as Amended
7704 / P440005-100000 / Urban Infrastructure Recovery Fund (Voted Carryover) / $5,999,688.00 / ($225,000.00) / $5,774,688.00
 
7704 / P440005-100077 / UIRF - 2025 Miscellaneous Right-of-Way Acquisitions (Voted Carryover) / $0.00 / $225,000.00 / $225,000.00
 
SECTION 2.  That the City Attorney's Office be, and hereby is, authorized to contract for professional services related to the acquisition of right-of-way, to negotiate with property owners to acquire additional rights-of-way, and to acquire fee simple title and lesser interests in and to certain parcels of real estate needed to complete UIRF projects in an amount up to $225,000.00. 
 
SECTION 3.  That the expenditure of $225,000.00, or so much thereof as may be needed, is hereby authorized in Fund 7704 (Street & Highways Bond Fund) in Dept-Div 5912 (Design and Construction), Project P440005-100077 (UIRF - 2025 Misc Right-of-Way Acquisitions), in Object Class 06 (Capital Outlay) per the accounting codes in the attachment to this ordinance. 
 
SECTION 4.  Funds are hereby deemed appropriated and expenditures and transfers authorized to carry out the purposes of this ordinance and the City Auditor shall establish such accounting codes as necessary.
 
SECTION 5.  That the City Auditor is authorized to make any accounting changes to revise the funding source for all contracts or contract modifications associated with this ordinance.
 
SECTION 6.  That the City Auditor is hereby authorized to transfer the unencumbered balance in a project account to the unallocated balance account within the same fund upon receipt of certification by the Director of the Department administering said project that the project has been completed and the monies are no longer required for said project.
 
SECTION 7.  That this ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after the earliest period allowed by law.
